title: Top 10 Things to Pack Before You Fly to Australia
summary: Don’t forget these essentials before your journey! Here’s a checklist for international students.
content:
## Top 10 Things to Pack Before You Fly to Australia

1. Passport & Visa
2. University documents
3. Weather-appropriate clothing
4. Power adapters
5. Medications & prescriptions
6. SIM card or unlocked phone
7. Emergency contacts
8. Personal hygiene items
9. Laptop & chargers
10. Snacks from home

**Tip:** Always check airline baggage rules!
author: Aisha Patel

title: How to Open a Bank Account as a Student
summary: Step-by-step guide to opening your first bank account in Australia.
content:
## How to Open a Bank Account as a Student

- Choose a bank (Commonwealth, ANZ, NAB, Westpac)
- Bring your passport, visa, and student ID
- Visit a branch or apply online
- Set up online banking

**Pro Tip:** Some banks offer student deals with no monthly fees!
author: Carlos Mendes

title: Best SIM Cards for International Students in Australia
summary: Stay connected! Here are the best SIM card options for new arrivals.
content:
## Best SIM Cards for International Students

- Optus: Great coverage, student plans
- Telstra: Widest network
- Vodafone: Good for international calls

**Tip:** Buy a SIM at the airport or online before you arrive.
author: Emily Zhang

title: What to Expect in Your First Week at University
summary: Orientation, making friends, and settling in: here’s what your first week will look like.
content:
## What to Expect in Your First Week

- Attend orientation events
- Meet your classmates
- Explore campus
- Set up your student email
- Register for classes

**Tip:** Don’t hesitate to ask questions—everyone is new!
author: Aisha Patel

title: How to Use Public Transport in Melbourne as a Student
summary: Trams, trains, and buses: your guide to getting around Melbourne.
content:
## How to Use Public Transport in Melbourne

- Get a Myki card
- Download the PTV app
- Check student discounts
- Plan your route

**Tip:** Always tap on and off with your Myki!
author: Carlos Mendes

title: Essential Healthcare Tips for International Students
summary: Stay healthy in Australia with these must-know tips.
content:
## Essential Healthcare Tips

- Register for OSHC (Overseas Student Health Cover)
- Find your nearest clinic
- Know emergency numbers
- Keep a copy of your health insurance

**Tip:** Your university may have a health center on campus.
author: Emily Zhang

title: Difference Between Temporary and Permanent Accommodation
summary: Short-term vs. long-term housing: what’s best for you?
content:
## Temporary vs. Permanent Accommodation

- Temporary: Hostels, hotels, short-term rentals
- Permanent: Student apartments, homestays, shared housing

**Tip:** Book temporary accommodation before you arrive, then search for permanent options once settled.
author: Aisha Patel
